answerText: Red Cavalry [or Cavalry Army][10] Red Cavalry is a collection by this Russian language author of the Odessa Tales who was sentenced to death by firing squad by the Stalinist regime.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 5 | 17 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The narrator of this collection meets a Jewish shopkeeper named Gedali as well as a rabbi's son named Ilya. [10] Name this collection about Kirill Lyutov who tries to gain the acceptance of the nachdiv in stories such as "A Letter," "Crossing the Zbruch," and "Two Ivans."
